intro: Dysoxylum pubescens, commonly known as the hairy dysoxylum, is a tropical tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its rough, pubescent bark and opposite, elliptical leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in humid, lowland environments and is often found in secondary forests. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and traditional medicine.
